posts.post_content:
This is a pretty strong candidate for the best card in New Phyrexia. This card is, by far, the most flexible card in standard - and maybe one of the most flexible cards in Magic, period. Not only because it can copy any artifact OR any creature, but it can also be played in any color. There are so many solid applications - even if, for instance you need another land for some reason. Why not animate a man land and play your metamorph? You have a shiny new land, as well.  
  
This card has so many amazing applications - take an equipment, take a creature. It's an excellent way to counter legendary creatures and, heck, with Liquimetal coating - you could even counter Planeswalkers. This card will find its way into a ridiculously high number of decks over time.
posts.html:
This is a pretty strong candidate for the best card in New Phyrexia. This card is, by far, the most flexible card in standard - and maybe one of the most flexible cards in Magic, period. Not only because it can copy any artifact OR any creature, but it can also be played in any color. There are so many solid applications - even if, for instance you need another land for some reason. Why not animate a man land and play your metamorph? You have a shiny new land, as well.

This card has so many amazing applications - take an equipment, take a creature. It's an excellent way to counter legendary creatures and, heck, with Liquimetal coating - you could even counter Planeswalkers. This card will find its way into a ridiculously high number of decks over time.

posts.post_content: That's funny, it sure doesn't *LOOK* like a [Sword of Body and Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Body and Mind), or a [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel), for as little as {3} you get a creatures (sometimes) and artifact (other times) and a removal spell (when copying legendary creatures like [Emrakul, The Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, The Aeons Torn) or legendary artifacts like [Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver)) ... all wrapped into one card, that you don't even have to splash {U} for (hypothetically speaking). So many uses, comes in as the best thing in play, and can be utilized with your own permanents, i mean really, who wouldn't want two [Myr Galvanizer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Galvanizer) instead of one?
posts.html:

So many uses, comes in as the best thing in play, and can be utilized with your own permanents, i mean really, who wouldn't want two Myr Galvanizer instead of one?

posts.post_content:
The love child of [clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=clone) and [sculpting steel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sculpting steel).  
Its difficult to understand the impact that this card is going to have right away, simply because its so versatile.  
Its cheap, can be used in any color, and can copy two of the most common types of permanents without targeting. Goodbye [Thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrun)  
A must have for me.
posts.html:
